text: Santa Maria delle Grazie is a Roman Catholic church in Milan. It has been an UNESCO World heritage site since the 1980s. Today, the church is mostly known as the place where Leonardo da Vinci painted his mural The Last Supper. The church belongs to the Dominican Order and is part of a larger complex. Category:Roman Catholic churches in Italy Category:Buildings and structures in Milan Category:15th-century buildings and structures
title: Santa Maria delle Grazie, Milan
